document_data.name: Bilberry
document_data.mainbody: '''Bilberries''' were a species of [[blueberry]] endemic to both the [[High Moor]] region and the [[Serpent Hills]].
document_data.Description: The fruit of bilberries grew on short, brittle branches with small round leaves. Their bush's tended to form dense, interwoven thickets that made it challenging to retrieve these berries.
document_data.Usage:
Said to be very palatable, the berries of this shrub were a staple in the diet of many animals that inhabited the High Moor plateau. With even [[human]]s and [[goblinkin]] known to forage for them.

Some used bilberry in the treatment of certain medical conditions, such as dropsy and typhoid.<ref>
